claim.text: locate every elementary school within a fifteen-minute walk of the homes it serves
claim.claim: Fifteen minutes is an appropriate/standard walking distance threshold for elementary school access

results.summary: Fifteen minutes (equivalent to approximately 0.5-1 mile) is a widely accepted standard for elementary school walking distance in urban planning and school siting guidelines.
results.detail: The Safe Routes to School program, various state education guidelines, and urban planning standards commonly reference 1 mile (approximately 15-20 minute walk) as the standard walk zone for elementary schools. The U.S. EPA, ASCE, and multiple state education departments use similar thresholds. The 15-minute standard aligns with walkability research showing that distances beyond this threshold significantly reduce walking rates among children. Many school districts define 'hazardous walking conditions' exemptions starting at or beyond 1 mile for elementary students.
sources: Safe Routes to School National Partnership guidelines
Multiple state education department transportation policies (typical standard: 1-1.5 miles for elementary, translating to 15-25 minute walks)
